inclusion.criterion: Age 18 to 65 years with body weight from 30 kg to 90 kg
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Sputum acid-fast bacilli (AFB) smear positive (at least 1+ on the WHO International Union Against Tuberculosis and Lung Disease scale)
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Likely able to produce approximately 10 mL of sputum per day
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: Rifampin-sensitive pulmonary tuberculosis as indicated by Xpert MTB/RIF
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: ALT <3X upper limit of normal, creatinine <2X upper limit of normal
inclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: Clinically suspected disseminated TB or acuity of illness too much as deemed by clinicians
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Has been treated for tuberculosis within the past 3 years
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Treatment with agents known to have anti-tuberculosis activity (e.g., fluoroquinolones, linezolid) for any indications during the current episode of clinical illness or within 2 months prior to screening, whichever is longer
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Disease complications or concomitant illness that might compromise safety or the interpretation of trial endpoints, such as known diagnosis of chronic inflammatory condition (e.g., sarcoidosis, rheumatoid arthritis, and connective tissue disorder)
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Use of immunosuppressive medications, such as TNF-alpha inhibitors or systemic or inhaled corticosteroids, within 2 weeks prior to screening
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Subjects with diabetes, point of care HbA1c above 6.5, or random glucose over 200 mg/dL
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Conditions which compromise the subject s ability to take or absorb oral drugs
exclusion.label: unknown

notes: Patient A is a 30-year-old male with symptoms of cough, profuse nocturnal sweating and loss of appetite. He has a positive sputum culture for Mycobacterium tuberculosis which are sensitive to first-line TB drugs.
